Zend_Gdata  
Gapps  
No 
No 

Description

Assists in constructing queries for Google Apps user entries.

Instances of this class can be provided in many places where a URL is required.

For information on submitting queries to a server, see the Google Apps service class, Zend_Gdata_Gapps.


Methods

__construct, getQueryUrl, getStartUsername, getUsername, setStartUsername, setUsername,

__construct( string   $domain = null, string   $username = null, string   $startUsername = null, ) : n/a

Description

Create a new instance.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$domain string | (optional) The Google Apps-hosted domain to use when constructing query URIs. null
$username string | (optional) Value for the username property. null
$startUsername string | (optional) Value for the startUsername property. null

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

getQueryUrl( ) : string

Description

Returns the query URL generated by this query instance.

Return value

Type Description
string The query URL for this instance.

getStartUsername( ) : string

Description

Get the first username which should be displayed when retrieving a list of users.

Return value

Type Description
string The first username to be returned, or null if disabled.

Tags

Name Description
see setStartUsername

getUsername( ) : n/a

Description

Get the username to query for. If no username is set, null will be returned.

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

setStartUsername( string   $value, ) : n/a

Description

Set the first username which should be displayed when retrieving a list of users.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$value string | The first username to be returned, or null to disable.

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

setUsername( string   $value, ) : n/a

Description

Set the username to query for. When set, only users with a username matching this value will be returned in search results. Set to null to disable filtering by username.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$value string | The username to filter search results by, or null to disable.

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

Tags

Name Description
see getUsername

Properties

$_username,

  protected  $_username = null

If not null, specifies the username of the user who should be retrieved by this query.string
